job_to_be_done.statement: Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked

prerequisites.requirement: Super admin access to payroll settings

data_inputs_required.details: Choose from: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.details: Proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method

steps: Go to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation
Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days)
If payroll month is open, reject existing prorated salary transactions

rules_limitations_constraints.rule: Changes will affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table
When payroll month is open, must reject existing prorated salary transactions before saving new settings

edge_cases_warnings.edge_case_or_warning: Existing prorated salary transactions must be manually rejected when changing proration settings during an open payroll month

glossary_terms.definition_from_docs: Tool for calculating prorated salaries based on selected calculation method

feature_interactions_dependencies.interaction: Interacts with Payroll system, Daily Wage Calculator (DWC), and affects active payroll table transactions

claims_to_validate.claim_text: Daily pay is calculated by dividing total salary by actual working days
claims_to_validate.validation_hint: Verify calculation method with payroll team

claims_to_validate.claim_text: Daily wage can be calculated using calendar days, working days, or custom days
claims_to_validate.validation_hint: Verify calculation methods in actual system

claims_to_validate.claim_text: Salary can be prorated using custom days, calendar days, or working days
claims_to_validate.validation_hint: Verify available calculation methods in Daily Wage Calculator
